00028 /* Includes ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00029 #include "ht32.h"
00030 #include "ht32_board.h"
00031 #include "ht32_board_config.h"
00032 
00033 /** @addtogroup HT32_Series_Peripheral_Examples HT32 Peripheral Examples
00034   * @{
00035   */
00036 
00037 /** @addtogroup GPIO_Examples GPIO
00038   * @{
00039   */
00040 
00041 /** @addtogroup InputOutput
00042   * @{
00043   */
00044 
00045 /* Private function prototypes -----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00046 void CKCU_Configuration(void);
00047 void GPIO_IN_Configuration(void);
00048 void GPIO_OUT_Configuration(void);
00049 void GPIO_MainRoutine(void);
00050 
00051 /* Private variables ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00052 FlagStatus TmpStatus = RESET;
00053 
00054 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00055 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00056   * @brief  Main program.
00057   * @retval None
00058   * @note At this stage the microcontroller clock setting should has already been configured.
00059   *       This can be done through SystemInit() function which is called from startup
00060   *       file (startup_ht32fxxxx.s) before branching to application main().
00061   *       To reconfigure the default setting of SystemInit() function, please refer to
00062   *       system_ht32fxxxx.c file
00063   * @details The main function works as the following:
00064   *    - Check if the backup domain is ready for access so as to disable isolation.
00065   *      Because some GPIO pins are located in the backup domain.
00066   *    - Enable AFIO peripheral clock
00067   *    - Configure WAKEUP, KEY1 pins as the input function
00068   *      - Enable GPIO peripheral clock of input pins
00069   *      - Configure AFIO mode of input pins
00070   *      - Configure GPIO direction of input pins
00071   *    - Configure LED1, LED2 pins as the output function
00072   *      - Enable GPIO peripheral clock of output pins
00073   *      - Configure AFIO mode of output pins
00074   *      - Configure GPIO direction of output pins
00075   *    - Infinite loop to read data from the input pin and then output to LED
00076   *      - Read WAKEUP and then output via LED1
00077   *      - Read KEY1 and then output via LED2
00078   *
00079   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00080 int main(void)
00081 {
00082   CKCU_Configuration();               /* System Related configuration                                       */
00083 
00084   /* Configure WAKEUP, KEY1 pins as the input function                                                      */
00085   GPIO_IN_Configuration();
00086 
00087   /* Configure LED1, LED2 pins as output function                                                           */
00088   GPIO_OUT_Configuration();
00089 
00090   /* Infinite loop to read data from input pin and then output to LED                                       */
00091   while (1)
00092   {
00093     GPIO_MainRoutine();
00094   }
00095 }
00096 
00097 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00098   * @brief  Configure the system clocks.
00099   * @retval None
00100   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00101 void CKCU_Configuration(void)
00102 {
00103   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00104 
00105   HTCFG_OUTPUT_LED1_CLK(CKCUClock) = 1;
00106   HTCFG_OUTPUT_LED2_CLK(CKCUClock) = 1;
00107   HTCFG_INPUT_WAKE_CLK(CKCUClock)  = 1;
00108   HTCFG_INPUT_KEY1_CLK(CKCUClock)  = 1;
00109   CKCUClock.Bit.AFIO       = 1;
00110   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00111 }
00112 
00113 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00114   * @brief  Configure the GPIO ports for input.
00115   * @retval None
00116   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00117 void GPIO_IN_Configuration(void)
00118 {
00119   /* Configure WAKEUP, KEY1 pins as the input function                                                      */
00120   /* Configure AFIO mode of input pins                                                                      */
00121   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_INPUT_WAKE_ID, HTCFG_INPUT_WAKE_AFIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_GPIO);
00122   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_INPUT_KEY1_ID, HTCFG_INPUT_KEY1_AFIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_GPIO);
00123 
00124   /* Configure GPIO direction of input pins                                                                 */
00125   GPIO_DirectionConfig(HTCFG_WAKE, HTCFG_INPUT_WAKE_GPIO_PIN, GPIO_DIR_IN);
00126   GPIO_DirectionConfig(HTCFG_KEY1, HTCFG_INPUT_KEY1_GPIO_PIN, GPIO_DIR_IN);
00127 
00128   /* Configure GPIO pull resistor of input pins                                                             */
00129   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(HTCFG_WAKE, HTCFG_INPUT_WAKE_GPIO_PIN, GPIO_PR_DOWN);
00130   GPIO_PullResistorConfig(HTCFG_KEY1, HTCFG_INPUT_KEY1_GPIO_PIN, GPIO_PR_UP);
00131 
00132   GPIO_InputConfig(HTCFG_WAKE, HTCFG_INPUT_WAKE_GPIO_PIN, ENABLE);
00133   GPIO_InputConfig(HTCFG_KEY1, HTCFG_INPUT_KEY1_GPIO_PIN, ENABLE);
00134 }
00135 
00136 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00137   * @brief  Configure the GPIO ports for output.
00138   * @retval None
00139   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00140 void GPIO_OUT_Configuration(void)
00141 {
00142   /* Configure LED1, LED2 pins as output function                                                           */
00143   /* Configure AFIO mode of output pins                                                                     */
00144   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_OUTPUT_LED1_ID, HTCFG_OUTPUT_LED1_AFIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_GPIO);
00145   AFIO_GPxConfig(HTCFG_OUTPUT_LED2_ID, HTCFG_OUTPUT_LED2_AFIO_PIN, AFIO_FUN_GPIO);
00146 
00147   /* Configure GPIO direction of output pins                                                                */
00148   GPIO_DirectionConfig(HTCFG_LED1, HTCFG_OUTPUT_LED1_GPIO_PIN, GPIO_DIR_OUT);
00149   GPIO_DirectionConfig(HTCFG_LED2, HTCFG_OUTPUT_LED2_GPIO_PIN, GPIO_DIR_OUT);
00150 }
00151 
00152 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00153   * @brief  GPIO Main Routine.
00154   * @retval None
00155   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00156 void GPIO_MainRoutine(void)
00157 {
00158   /* Read WAKEUP and then output to LED1                                                                    */
00159   TmpStatus = GPIO_ReadInBit(HTCFG_WAKE, HTCFG_INPUT_WAKE_GPIO_PIN);
00160   GPIO_WriteOutBits(HTCFG_LED1, HTCFG_OUTPUT_LED1_GPIO_PIN, TmpStatus);
00161 
00162   /* Read KEY1 and then output to LED2                                                                      */
00163   TmpStatus = GPIO_ReadInBit(HTCFG_KEY1, HTCFG_INPUT_KEY1_GPIO_PIN);
00164   GPIO_WriteOutBits(HTCFG_LED2, HTCFG_OUTPUT_LED2_GPIO_PIN, TmpStatus);
00165 }
00166 
00167 #if (HT32_LIB_DEBUG == 1)
00168 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00169   * @brief  Report both the error name of the source file and the source line number.
00170   * @param  filename: pointer to the source file name.
00171   * @param  uline: error line source number.
00172   * @retval None
00173   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00174 void assert_error(u8* filename, u32 uline)
00175 {
00176   /*
00177      This function is called by IP library that the invalid parameters has been passed to the library API.
00178      Debug message can be added here.
00179      Example: printf("Parameter Error: file %s on line %d\r\n", filename, uline);
00180   */
00181 
00182   while (1)
00183   {
00184   }
00185 }
00186 #endif
